generif.text: Nrf3 is a negative regulator of ARE-mediated gene expression of NQO1
NRF3 is highly expressed in primary placental cytotrophoblasts
Nrf3 is an N-glycosylated protein associated with the endoplasmic reticulum

17beta-Estradiol treatment significantly increased but VC or Res decreased Nrf3 mRNA and protein expression levels.
findings reveal FBW7 and GSK3 as novel regulators of the NFE2L3 transcription factor and a potential mechanism by which FBW7 might regulate detoxification and the cellular response to stress

SNPs associated with type 2 diabetes and obesity may also increase the risk of developing gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) in the Chinese population. Among these SNPs, we report for the first time that rs945508 in ARHGEF11, rs10804591 in PLXND1 and rs10245353 in NFE2L3 were associated with GDM.
Multiple regulatory mechanisms of the biological function of NFE2L3 control proliferation of cancer cells.
confirmed the regulatory role of NFE2L3 on VEGFA, an important player involved in tumor angiogenesis

Study identified that NFE2L3 was closely associated with the grade and stage of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) patients based on the TCGA database. Furthermore, study showed that shRNA-mediated knockdown of NFE2L3 exhibited tumor-suppressing effects in HCC cells.
Downregulation of NFE2L3 induces G0/G1 phase arrest in colorectal cancer cells through downregulation of CCND1 and pRb1-ser807/811.
we observed that the beta-catenin/TCF4 complex mediates NRF3 expression by binding directly to the WRE site.
analysis provides a comprehensive description of differential and overlapping gene regulation by the transcriptional regulators NFE2L1(NRF1), NFE2L2 (NRF2), and NFE2L3 (NRF3).
NFE2L3 Controls Colon Cancer Cell Growth through Regulation of DUX4, a CDK1 Inhibitor.
NRF3-POMP-20S Proteasome Assembly Axis Promotes Cancer Development via Ubiquitin-Independent Proteolysis of p53 and Retinoblastoma Protein.
NFE2L1 and NFE2L3 Complementarily Maintain Basal Proteasome Activity in Cancer Cells through CPEB3-Mediated Translational Repression.
Elevated expression of NFE2L3 promotes the development of gastric cancer through epithelial-mesenchymal transformation.
NFE2L3 promotes tumor progression and predicts a poor prognosis of bladder cancer.
Transcription factor NFE2L3 promotes the proliferation of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma cells and causes radiotherapy resistance by regulating IL-6.
NFE2L3 as a Potential Functional Gene Regulating Immune Microenvironment in Human Kidney Cancer.
Hypomethylation-Mediated Upregulation of NFE2L3 Promotes Malignant Phenotypes of Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma Cells.
NRF3 suppresses squamous carcinogenesis, involving the unfolded protein response regulator HSPA5.
Identification roles of NFE2L3 in digestive system cancers.

interpro.desc: Transcription factor, Skn-1-like, DNA-binding domain superfamily

name: NFE2 like bZIP transcription factor 3
summary: This gene encodes a member of the cap 'n' collar basic-region leucine zipper family of transcription factors. The encoded protein heterodimerizes with small musculoaponeurotic fibrosarcoma factors to bind antioxidant response elements in target genes. This protein is a membrane bound glycoprotein that is targeted to the endoplasmic reticulum and the nuclear envelope. Pseudogenes of this gene are found on chromosomes 16, 17, and 18. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2009].
